alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 1:37AM PDT until August 12 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low lying areas around Humboldt Bay. Hide tide is predicted to be 8.18 feet at the North Spit tide gauge around 12 AM tonight, and tidal anomalies have been running up to 0.7 foot above predicted values. Minor flooding is possible when tide levels reach 8.8 feet. * WHERE...Around Humboldt Bay, including King Salmon and possibly into Jackson Ranch Road. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 1 AM PDT Friday.. . * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...King Salmon is the most likely to observe minor flooding around high tide tonight.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT.
